result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott M Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 11-16-2015 at 09:55 am

State moves to amend the charge to a DC.

from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.

Defendant Scott M Anderson in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft is in treatment now.
Def is requesting an adjournment.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.
Status conference on July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons on his person outside of home or vehicle. He may possess firearms in his home. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Scott M Anderson in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  
Defendant has obtained counsel but would like to proceed w/o him for todays hearing. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
